intro: Ottonia brevistipata, commonly known as the short-tipped ottonia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Ottonia brevistipata thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
